lcInstruction.p: There are two elements you can use for additional information between <step> elements, and before the <cmd> element.

li.p: The <stepsection> element allows you to add comments between two steps. This can be useful if you need to make a comment to the reader about the steps themselves, such as “The remaining steps focus on the the x component” or “The next two steps must be performed in a y environment.”

You can use a <note> or <hazardstatement> element before a <cmd> element in a <step> or <substep>. Typically, you use this when you need to alert readers about a risk or danger before they read or perform the <cmd> action.
